detail.content: Radio Broadcasting: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Radio Broadcasting  H56.1125 Lecture 3 Credits Course Level: Intermediate     ( Also known as On-Air Techniques. ) Not currently being offered. Prerequisite: Permission of instructor.    This is special intensive seminar on the development of successful on-air and voice-over techniques. Taught by a radio professional, students receive individual training in the delivery of radio news, commercials, and announcing, as well as voice-over narration for film and television. Students will produce an audition tape. Prerequisite: Permission of instructor.    This is special intensive seminar on the development of successful on-air and voice-over techniques. Taught by a radio professional, students receive individual training in the delivery of radio news, commercials, and announcing, as well as voice-over narration for film and television. Students will produce an audition tape. Guide to the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA) National    Office Records    WAG.281                    See all finding aids in this repository Table of Contents           Descriptive Summary    Historical/Biographical Note    Scope and Contents and Arrangement    Access Points    Administrative Information    Container List     Series I: Constitutions, By-Laws, Agreements, Codes and Contracts     Series II: Administrative Files     Series III: Conventions     Series IV: Locals     Series V: Networks     Series VI: Negotiations     Series VII: Merger     Series VIII: Charges, Claims, and Arbitrations     Series IX: Other Unions/Guilds/Federations     Series X: Archived Websites                          Print / View Finding Aid as Single Page Guide to the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA) National     Office Records     WAG.281                Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 70 Washington Square South New York, NY, 10012 (212) 998-2630 tamiment.wagner@library.nyu.edu  Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive      Collection processed by K. Kevyne Baar with Ellie d'Eustachio, Aidan Kinney, Kelsey      Marksteiner          This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit      on June 24, 2014 Description is in English. using Describing Archives: A Content Standard           Revised by Rachel Searcy  , January 2013                      Container List                               Series I: Constitutions, By-Laws, Agreements, Codes and Contracts, 1943 - 1996                            Scope and Content Note                   This series is comprised of constitutions and by-laws for both AFRA and AFTRA, as          well as national agreements, codes and contracts. These files document the fundamental          principles of the organization and the internal rules for how to conduct activities.
